item.title: Not included in f1 help
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

The function is called random()
The + - \ * are just operators infront of it.

Like… 1 + 1;
This is random(10) + 1

Read full topic

item.title: Not included in f1 help
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Arrays… Case statements… Various other functions/procedures also not explained or even mentioned.

You can see all the procedures and functions in scar by typing in a . anywhere in the script. Just type in 1 . and then wait about 2 seconds and a menu should popup.

Read full topic

item.title: Not included in f1 help
item.dc:creator: @aps aps
item.description:
@aps wrote:

I know a couple of things not inculuded in the F1 Help thing

+random(‘number goes here’);

ie. wait(100+random(100);

for randoms you can also do -random, *random, or /random.

also the ability to do something better in the until zone

ie. until(isfkeydown(9));

until(GetTickCount - StartTime > 5000);
for this one you need the variable StartTime as an integer, and StartTime:= GetTickCount… after BEGIN
this will make it so that your script will run for the specified amount of time.

width and hieght integer.

ie.

movemouse(random(width), random(hieght));

i am probably forgetting something, but if i am and you know something i dont, post it here.

Read full topic
